intro: Endoptera intermedia, commonly known as the common blue butterfly, is a species of butterfly found in various parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Lycaenidae and is characterized by its striking blue wings. The plant association of this species is primarily with grasses and legumes, which serve as host plants for its larvae. The adult butterfly feeds on nectar from a variety of flowering plants, including thistles and umbellifers. Its life cycle involves a complex relationship with fungi, which the larvae consume as a primary food source.
